stringFromToInts.cc

00001 #include <lcio.h>
00002 #include <IMPL/LCGenericObjectImpl.h>
00003 #include "stringFromToInts.hh"
00004 
00005 namespace CALICE {
00006   unsigned int getNeededInts(const std::string &a_string) 
00007   {
00008     return getNeededInts(a_string.size());
00009   }
00010   
00011   unsigned int convertStringToInts(lcio::LCGenericObjectImpl *an_obj, const std::string &a_string, unsigned int string_start_index, unsigned int string_length_index)
00012   {
00013     // unsigned int name_ints=getNeededInts(a_string);
00014 
00015     // since strings are not supported in the LCGenericObject, the string is encoded as integers.
00016     an_obj->setIntVal(string_length_index,(int) a_string.size());
00017     unsigned int index=string_start_index;
00018     for (unsigned int i=0; i<a_string.size(); i+=sizeof(int)) {
00019       unsigned int encoded_chars=0;
00020       for (unsigned int char_i=sizeof(int); char_i-->0;) {
00021         encoded_chars<<=8;
00022         if (i+char_i < a_string.size()) {
00023           //FIXME: will not work with UTF-16
00024           encoded_chars+=(a_string[i+char_i] & 0xff);
00025         }
00026       }
00027       an_obj->setIntVal(index,static_cast<int>(encoded_chars));
00028       index++;
00029     }
00030     return index;
00031   }
00032 
00037   std::string getStringFromInts(lcio::LCGenericObjectImpl *an_obj, unsigned int string_start_index, unsigned int string_length_index)
00038   {
00039     unsigned int string_length=an_obj->getIntVal(string_length_index);
00040     std::string a_string;
00041     a_string.resize(string_length);
00042     unsigned int index=string_start_index;
00043     for (unsigned int i=0; i<string_length; i+=sizeof(int)) {
00044       unsigned int encoded_chars=an_obj->getIntVal(index);
00045       unsigned int n_chars=sizeof(int);
00046       if (n_chars+i>string_length) {
00047         n_chars=string_length-i;
00048       }
00049       for (unsigned int char_i=0; char_i<n_chars; char_i++) {
00050         //FIXME: will not work with UTF-16
00051         a_string[i+char_i]=(encoded_chars & 0xff);
00052         encoded_chars>>=8;
00053       }
00054       index++;
00055     }
00056     return a_string;
00057   }
00058 }
